description:
Add a surface flux of passive tracer at the same rate as the surface heat flux perturbation, calculated from the ensemble mean of the CMIP5 1pctCO2 simulations at the time of CO2 doubling.
Impose pre-industrial atmospheric conditions. Branch from the piControl at the same point as the 1pctCO2 experiment.
This experiment does not affect the model evolution,  so the experiment is equivalent to the piControl with an extra diagnostic tracer.
keywords: FAFMIP, Tier 2, passiveheat, surface heat flux anomaly, passive tracer
long_name: control plus surface flux of passive heat tracer into ocean
rationale: Heat flux changes are thought to be the main influence on Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC) change.  Comparison with faf-heat will allow the effect on the distribution of added heat from changes in ocean heat transport to be assessed because these changes do not occur in the faf-passiveheat experiment.

requirements.description: Add a surface flux of passive tracer at the same rate as the surface heat flux perturbation in the faf-heat experiment.  The passive tracer flux will be added to the top layer of a passive temperature tracer.  Surface flux anomalies (a function of longitude, latitude and time of year) are to remain constant throughout the experiment.  The method for implementing the passive tracer should follow that used by Bouttes and Gregory (2014).
requirements.keywords: FAFMIP, 1pctCO2, heat flux, passive tracer, 2xCO2, at CO2 doubling
requirements.label: 1pctCO2PassiveTracerAtDoubling
